txt.en: Indeed, all your lives are forfeit for treachery against Ugrukhôr, Captain of the Pit
A murmur issues from the gathered crowd
'I did not say we would stay. Although... many opportunities now lie open in this land.'
Defeat the Rogmul Rúthragon
'Hhhem!'
'If we do return, I will  gladly  bring so many skilled labourers with me as my slaves.'
'Hrgh! You drive your bargain hard, Lord Khôpol. But Orcs and Dwarves are no slaves.'
'You thought the Great Eye's fall meant you could go scurrying off into the cracks?'
'He speaks of bargaining, as if they had something to offer in return.'
'A new order is coming and Ugrukhôr will play his part.'
'Did you hear something?'
'Indeed, it seems all you have to haggle with is your lives.'
Talk to Gradrágh
DNT '[placeholder], why is the meeting flag still raised. We are all here.'
The meeting is beginning.
'Naught to bargain with? Ha! Then you have no idea what secrets lie buried within Udûn!'
'It goes, it goes! You and I listen and watch, yes? Let others do the talking. That is best.'
DNT 'It draws attention. I do not like it - what was that?'
'Buried secrets? Lead me to them and I will judge of them myself.'
'We will bring you proofs of the whole. We are not fools enough to place all the gold in your hands, first.'
Gradrágh asked you to pull down the meeting flag, as it is no longer needed and only draws attention to the covert gathering.
A louder, more dismayed murmur rises from among the forge-workers
The meeting is underway. Can Gradrágh salvage the situation?
Gradrágh beckons you over
Take down the meeting flag
A covert meeting between the forge-workers and the Easterling contingent might just yield a way out of Udûn.
'But he is not to be trifled with.'
'And he's got powerful allies now, maggots!'
DNT TEST TEST TEST
'Eyes everyhwere. Blades waiting. Ahahaha!'
TBD
DNT *grumble* *grumble*
DNT how can that be?
now now!
DNT talk to the overseer
Watch and listen
DNT gar!
Instance: What Was Spoken and What Revealed
Talk to Kurtil
'You miserable maggots! Take that!'
Watch and listen
'Run, cowards. Run or die!'
Though the Rogmul and Enforcer have fallen, the damage is done - all hope is broken and scattered to the winds
Watch and listen
DNT what, not leaving?
'[placeholder], why is the meeting flag still raised? We are all here. It draws attention. I do not like it.\n\n'Go, pull it down.'
Talk to Kurtil
Watch and listen
See who approaches
Things are not going well. Kurtil has motioned you over.
Do not hand them all the gold, dwarf, for it is not yours
Gradrágh has beckoned you over.
Defeated the Rogmul Rúthragon
It seems that Kurtil wants to whisper something to you.
Defeated Grúshat the Thrasher
DNT Though the Rogmul and Enforcer have fallen, the damage is done - all hope is broken and scattered to the winds
DNT Do not hand them all the gold, Dwarf, for it is not yours
Watch and listen
The meeting is underway. The forge-workers are presenting their case.
DNT Do not hand them all the gold, Dwarf, for it is not yours
Defeat Grúshat the Thrasher
DNT Do not hand them all the gold, Dwarf, for it is not yours
The enforcer and Rogmul are defeated, but the parley is lost beyond hope.
The meeting is underway. The two sides do not yet see eye to eye.
DNT
DNT talk to kurtil
'The enforcers. We're done for now!'
'And beside him-- a dread, a Rogmul!'
The meeting is underway. Can Gradrágh salvage the situation?
'Ai, we have nowhere to run!'
'Defend yourselves - or flee!'
All hope is lost
'You thought to escape the notice of Ugrukhôr, Captain of the Pit.'
'Fah! This is not the way. No, no.'\n\nBut rather than speak, Kurtil kicks Overseer Gradrágh in the foot. The two meet eyes and the overseer clears his throat.
What menacing voice spoke those words? See who approaches.
'Gar! Seems I've got to get my hands dirty and do this myself.'
'You speak of returning east with my company.'
'I will tear you to shreds even if it is the end of me!'
'You have the long and the short of it, aye.'
'You'll pay for crossing the Captain, pay dearly!'
'We wish only to live, far from the cruel swords of Gondor.'
'Yet we have made no plans to return to the East.'
'No plans? Staying would be madness!'
'Still, if you go -- will you take us with you?'
'Yes, take us with you if you go.'
